text: Kim Kyok-sik (; 5 October 1938 - 10 May 2015) was a North Korean general and politician. From November 2012 until May 2013, he was the Defence Minister of North Korea. He was thought to have been behind two attacks on South Korea that killed 50 people in 2010. Kim died from acute respiratory failure on 10 May 2015, aged 76. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Deaths from respiratory failure Category:North Korean generals Category:North Korean politicians
title: Kim Kyok-sik
